issuetype.name: Story

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Not release critical, but would be fantastic since it helps complete the copy/paste functionality. It could be along-running since a folder can contain many objects (so, like the delete-all functionality)
fields.summary: Object Storage: Support copy folder operation

comments.body:
[~jloza], to clarify. I assume I need to support someone in the bucket contents landing page, selecting "copy" from the action menu of a folder, then in that or another bucket, selecting "paste".
I assume they could also copy from the bucket landing page (where all buckets are listed), and paste the folder into an existing bucket.
hey [~dkavanagh], yep, you're right. I updated the wireframe for the S3 landings to clarify the copy and paste folder menu options. Let me know if there's anything else you find! Good catch!
almost working last night. turns out copying a sub-folder requires doing some path math to avoid using the entire path in the new location.

Thanks, [~dkavanagh]. 

* when I went to paste a folder I got a weird confirmation dialog that makes no sense. A user should not have to confirm a paste op, it should just paste and give them the dialog shown on https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/display/3UD/Manage+Buckets+Landing+Page which allows them to cancel a paste op if they want to and gives progress. Please implement this that way. 
* i tried to paste a folder into its current location which we should not allow (don't show the paste folder button when the user is in the same path as the folder that's copied) 
* it let me paste the folder here (it was one of the ones with nested folders and objects, and the success message appeared to actually be a failure? attaching screenshot. Paste seemed to work OK if I selected a different location.
Assigning to Kamal for pre-demo merge. Please re-assign to Jenny after for further UX review.
Pull request 1044 merged.  Assigned this ticket to [~jloza] for further UX review.  Use develop branch for additional UX review since the GUI-1271 branch has been merged/deleted.

Still seeing some of the same things I listed before:

* i tried to paste a folder into its current location which we should not allow (don't show the paste folder button when the user is in the same path as the folder that's copied)
* it let me paste the folder here (it was one of the ones with nested folders and objects, and the success message appeared to actually be a failure? attaching screenshot. Paste seemed to work OK if I selected a different location

I'm re-working some of the logic for enabling paste object/folder button/menus. It could potentially get called many times per page view, so I'm refactoring to pre-calculate some values a single time for the page.

Hi D! Some things fixed, some things broken...getting there!

Am I supposed to be using develop or the GUI-1271 branch to UX review? Ticket says develop but I used GUI-1271 which seems to be where you're doing work. Please let me know.

* Paste button no longer appears in original location, yay!
* However, I no longer get the paste folder progress dialog, there's no indication something is happening until all of a sudden the stuff pastes. What happened to the progress dialog?

Sorry, I didn't link the PR:https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1074

you need to use the branch till this is merged.
i was in the right branch, I think the progress thing still needs fixing. See previous comment. Thanks!

Awesome! Progress dialog is back! 

One last thing that seems just a little weird: The success growl says something liek "Item successfully copied" but it appears after you've pasted, not after you've copied, and copy ops generally don't give success feedback anyway. Also, there's already visual feedback that the paste op succeeded (you see the folder or object in its new location). Can you get rid of that success message, and not have the growl display at all for copy/paste ops (object or folder)?
pushed a fix (bucket list and bucket contents screens)
UX review passed, ready for code review
